subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing for MIDP applications?
msgSnippet: Write a thin layer that hides the socket interface, provides only the functionality you need on the J2ME target and delegates to the appropriate API. (?) ...
messageBody:
Write a thin layer that hides the socket interface, provides only the
functionality you need on the J2ME target and delegates to the
appropriate API. (?)

On 4 Oct 2001, Brian Button wrote:

> The ability to write our code according to JUnit and J2SE and then
> just build as you said would be great. I'm just a novice at this J2ME
> MIDP stuff, but my pair partner is pretty experienced. He seems to
> believe that we'll have a problem following a model like this for the
> connection and socket stuff, since the API is different. Have you
> encountered this?

--
Eric Vought
Chief Technical Officer - QLUE Consulting, Inc.
